comment: Best advice I can give: if this is your last option and you have to take this class to graduate, wait until next semester and try again finding ANY other professor. You will be wasting your time in this class. After adddrop, we went from a class of 70 to 17. No feedback. Thick accent and hard to understand. Class based off book (terrible book).
All Exam and Quiz problems are from the book. The material is hard (regardless of teacher) but if you study, you will pass. I wish i had taken her in previous courses!
Fantastic Lovable Obligated Relatable   She is the bee's knees. Always willing to help and is very funny. Don't listen to those knuckle heads that say she is hard.  (This is Caleb by the way)

Professor Espinoza is a great teacher. At the beginning of the semester I thought this would be my hardest class and it was, mostly in part to Amazon loosing my text. When I spoke with FLor during office hours she was able to provide the extra help I needed to catch up and I am truly greatfull for that.

She has a passion for teaching that is evident in her approach to this difficult course. You will be challenged, but if plan your schedule right you will do good. I was far from a math wiz when I began, but by the end I was inspired and knew I could excel in any course if I put in the time. She is willing to help and very nice. I highly recommend!

The class itself was very difficult.  YOU MUST WORK FOR YOUR GRADE. If you don't put in the work you won't pass. She is very willing to help you. If you care about your grades and show that to her she will help as much as possible. She is extremely nice and loves her job. She wants students to actually learn this stuff not just get through it.

If you're an average student, then you will not pass her class if you do not take advantage of her extra credit opportunities. You will take a quiz or test at least once a week - all problems will be from the book, but do not expect them to be easy. Beware that she is scattered and is likely to ramble during class about her personal problems.
Tests are based off the book, but the hardest questions in it.  She chooses to do the easy questions in class.

She goes over the easiest examples that are WORKED OUT in the book, but gives the most difficult problems on quizzes and tests, (which are problems found in the book). Extra credit is optional, and is NEEDED to maintain a good grade. Not given adequate time for tests and quizzes, sighting our lack of studying skills for not finishing. Do not take.

Don't. Yeah she offers extra credit, but its not really optional because you will not have time to finish the tests no matter how well you know the material, so you have to do her stupid "optional" assignments to make up for the points you didn't even get to attempt. You will regret it. I did.

Dr. Espinoza is a great, fun, and friendly teacher. Her class was hard I'm not going to lie but it is doable if you work hard. She has office hours when you can get extra help outside of class and she gave a lot of extra credit by the end of the semester. She is more than willing to help any student who wants to do well!!

MULTIPLE CHOICE questions?? this is MATH. I am pretty sure math professors are more interested in your PROCESS than an answer. Plus, she/he might even give you partial points for getting the concept right even if your answer is incorrect.

She is really funny and works hard to try and make calculus interesting. Sometimes she can be confusing and over explain easy things and not explain hard things well at all. She gives a lot of extra credit though and as long as you practice outside of class you should do fine. I would take her again.

Calc is really hard (had to take it twice). Prof Flor is very helpful. She will review past concepts (high school alg) if necessary. She does expect you to study on your own but take advantage of her office hours (she gets in real early). She will help you where she can. Also do any extra credit assignment she gives. A is possible, even in Calc.

She was really nice and always willing to help and made the class fun; however her tests and quizzes were impossible and she grades really hard.  She does give out extra credit, but grades the extra credit had as well. Her accent did not get in the way it was more the class's level of difficulty. I would not recommend her.

Hard to understand. Very hard exams, no multiple choice, and there is harder material on exam then covered in class. She is very nice but if you do not study you will fail. Half the class dropped and the other half will most likely fail.
She is very nice and tries to be helpful by offering many extra credit opportunities. However, she sometimes has difficulty understanding questions from the students. YOU MUST STUDY for her class.

She is a very challenging teacher and it will be hard to pass. She does give some extra credit at the end though because everyone is failing the class. She is very willing to help you but doesn't have a good enough grasp on the material to understand it.
